q: Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.
h:
“Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.” —
Huang Po

q: A minute's success pays the failure of years.
h:
“A minute's success pays the failure of years.” —
Robert Browning

q: While we may not be able to control all that happens to us, we can control what happens inside us.
h:
“While we may not be able to control all that happens to us, we can control what happens inside us.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Success is a poor teacher.
h:
“Success is a poor teacher.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.
h:
“Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: No man can get rich himself unless he enriches others.
h:
“No man can get rich himself unless he enriches others.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground upon which I stand.
h:
“My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground upon which I stand.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
h:
“A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.
h:
“Fiction is the truth inside the lie.” —
Stephen King

q: Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.
h:
“Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.
h:
“Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.
h:
“Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.” —
Will Rogers

q: Convinced myself, I seek not to convince.
h:
“Convinced myself, I seek not to convince.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.
h:
“Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.” —
James Cameron

q: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
h:
“People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
h:
“Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
h:
“There are no shortcuts to any place worth going. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Keep true. Never be ashamed of doing right. Decide what you think is right and stick to it.
h:
“Keep true. Never be ashamed of doing right. Decide what you think is right and stick to it.” —
George Eliot

q: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
h:
“Art is to console those who are broken by life.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well.
h:
“Life is not always a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well. ” —
Jack London

q: You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.
h:
“You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
h:
“A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: One of the really tough things is figuring out what questions to ask. Once you figure out the question, then the answer is relatively easy.
h:
“One of the really tough things is figuring out what questions to ask. Once you figure out the question, then the answer is relatively easy.” —
Elon Musk

q: When uncomfortable, my instinct is not to avoid the discomfort but to become at peace with it.
h:
“When uncomfortable, my instinct is not to avoid the discomfort but to become at peace with it.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.
h:
“Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.” —
St. Jerome

q: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
h:
“It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.” —
John Lennon

q: Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.
h:
“Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.” —
Gary Keller

q: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
h:
“We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: It's better to stand by someone's side than by yourself.
h:
“It's better to stand by someone's side than by yourself.” —
Jack London

q: What's right is what's left if you do everything else wrong.
h:
“What's right is what's left if you do everything else wrong.” —
Robin Williams

q: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
h:
“If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.” —
Alexander Pope

q: You can live a whole life time never being awake.
h:
“You can live a whole life time never being awake.” —
Dan Millman

q: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.
h:
“Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: The outer conditions of a person's life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs.
h:
“The outer conditions of a person's life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs.” —
James Allen

q: There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.
h:
“There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
h:
“Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
h:
“Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.” —
Carl Jung

q: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
h:
“Walk slowly but never walk backward.” —
Unknown

q: The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.
h:
“The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.” —
Robin Williams

q: Confidence is the greatest friend.
h:
“Confidence is the greatest friend.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.
h:
“Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
h:
“Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.
h:
“Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.” —
Jack Butcher

q: A person hears only what they understand.
h:
“A person hears only what they understand.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: The greatest doer must also be a great dreamer.
h:
“The greatest doer must also be a great dreamer.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
h:
“Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Believe you can and you will be halfway there.
h:
“Believe you can and you will be halfway there.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.
h:
“Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The greatest miracle is to be alive.
h:
“The greatest miracle is to be alive.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh
